title: Cialdini's Six Principles at Work
description: A quick, practical guide to Cialdini's Six Principles at Work.

hook.text: Robert Cialdini spent years studying what makes people say yes. He found six universal principles.

buildup.text: Reciprocity, commitment, social proof, authority, liking, and scarcity â€” they work in every workplace.

discovery.text: Reciprocity: do a favor first. Commitment: get a small yes before the big ask. Social proof: 'The team agrees.'

twist.text: These principles are ethically neutral â€” they work for influence and manipulation alike. Intent matters.

climax.text: Awareness of these principles also makes you resistant to being manipulated by others.

punchline.text: Understand persuasion. Use it honestly. Spot it when others don't.

quiz.question: What are Cialdini's six principles of persuasion?
options: Reciprocity, commitment, social proof, authority, liking, scarcity
Logic, emotion, credibility, timing, volume, repetition
Trust, respect, power, charm, fear, reward
